intro: Dimorphocalyx lawianus, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
